etymology.interpretation: A roof signifies a dwelling, evoking someone staying under another’s roof as a guest. 各 provides the sound value approximating kè, while the roof element conveys the sense of lodging and hospitality.

examples.chinese: 晚上我们家来了两位客人(晚上我們家來了兩位客人)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnshang wǒmen jiā láile liǎng wèi kèrén.
examples.english: Two guests came to our home in the evening.

examples.chinese: 这家店很注重老客户(這家店很注重老客戶)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn hěn zhùzhòng lǎo kèhù.
examples.english: This shop values its regular customers.

examples.chinese: 他是过路客(他是過路客)，不会久留(不會久留)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì guòlù kè, bù huì jiǔliú.
examples.english: He is a passerby guest and won’t stay long.
